intro: Cassia burttii, commonly known as golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow, pendulous flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces elongated pods that contain flat, seed-rich seeds. Cassia burttii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for tropical and subtropical climates.
